unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify and evaluate ethical speech pathology practice for people with speech and language disorders, focusing on client-centred care. (CBOS 4  5, 7 1).

Align principles and practices informed by current knowledge about language, cognition, and learning with client-centred care, focusing on the psychosocial implications of speech and language disorders. (CBOS 3 2, 3 5, 3 6).
Apply theoretically motivated and evidence-based principles to planning speech pathology interventions for people with speech and language disorders. (RPP 1, 3 1, 3 4, 3 7).

Analyse and evaluate the implications of current knowledge about language, cognition, and learning for speech pathology practice; particularly interventions targeting body functions and structures. (RPP 1, CBOS 1 2, 2 1, 2 2, 2 3).

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Before and after class learning activities including readings, small group work, development of materials shared with peers, engagement in online discussion.

assessments.assessment_title: Case-based assessment: Adult speech and language disorders
assessments.description: In this assessment task, students will be provided with case information relating to adults who have speech and language disorders. They will be also be provided with clinical scenarios, and asked to develop plans relating to speech pathology intervention for these adults. The assessment task will require them to integrate and synthesise case background, case data, theory, research evidence, and routine speech pathology practices in order to formulate plans.

assessments.assessment_title: Case-based assessment: Child speech and language disorders
assessments.description: In this assessment task, students will be provided with case information relating to children who have speech and language disorders. They will be also be provided with clinical scenarios, and asked to develop plans relating to speech pathology intervention for these children. The assessment task will require them to integrate and synthesise case background, case data, theory, research evidence, and routine speech pathology practices in order to formulate plans.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: In this unit students will gain advanced knowledge of a range of theoretically and empirically informed intervention principles, and their application across the range of speech pathology practice. Students will focus on applying these principles differentially to interventions for speech and language disorders in children and adults.
data.title: Speech Pathology Intervention 2
